intro: Gonolobus exannulatus, commonly known as the narrow-leafed dodder, is a flowering plant in the family Convolvulaceae. It is a hemiparasitic plant, meaning it partially attaches to host plants to obtain water and nutrients. The plant has slender, twining stems and small, opposite leaves that are typically narrow and linear. Its flowers are usually pale green to yellowish and appear in clusters. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is often found growing on a variety of herbaceous hosts.
